ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned about different ways to evoke music and write about music.
Developed the ability to tactfully discuss culture, particularly music. Read many pieces by notable music critics and gained knowledge of their techniques.
I got a lot better at writing! The course gives good feedback and allows you to try out writing in many different forms including profiles, research pieces, evocations, and more.
you will learn how to write about music so well
I developed a deeper knowledge of music writing in a variety of forms.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths included the selection of readings along with the structure of the course.

Strengths: Prof. Sexton is a wonderful discussion leader that is good at knowing when to move on from a point and when to linger on a point for longer. The papers are varied in topic and format, so if you don't resonate with one, you might enjoy another. 

Weaknesses: Not all of the readings are covered in class, which can sting after you spend a long time considering and reading a text.

A weakness of the course was that at times it could feel a little too fast paced with essays coming quickly after one another. Strengths of this course are that I learned a lot, became a better writer, listened to a lot of new, great music, and met some cool people.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would highly recommend this course to anyone regardless of their music experience.
Yes. It's a fun, unique writing class that develops your writing skills in a niche that you have probably never explored.
Yes! You will become a better writer and get to listen to and explore new music and Adam Sexton is a gem.
I absolutely would! Professor Sexton is such a great professor and this course was super engaging overall. Anybody who likes music should take it.
